docs.lead_paragraph: Women who suffer from recurring vaginal yeast infections recently got some good news: Gyne-Lotrimin, a drug frequently prescribed by physicians for that problem, became available as an over-the-counter drug. It will soon be joined by Monistat, a similar prescription drug, which was approved this month by the Federal Food and Drug Administration for nonprescription sales. Other prescription drugs may also be crossing to over-the-counter status soon. F.D.A. officials are considering about 20 proposals to make prescriptioningredients available without a prescription to treat problems like bee stings, acne or ulcers.
